children.subject: +1 I loved this course and it was a stepping stone to me becoming a TA the following semester!
For the application, are we expected to respond to the questions in essay format or is it more of a short few sentence reponse?

history.content:
Hello Students!

Our CS370: "Teaching Computer Science" application is officially open! CS370 is our equity-based CS pedagogy course that meets the course requirement for TAs. It's a highly interactive class where you participate in building materials and resources to help you as a tutor, mentor, and TA--most of the material translates well to industry and academia too. Anyone who has attended Cal for one semester and isn't graduating next semester is eligible to apply.

This course is 3 units and does require tutoring each week (1-3 hours per week depending on your potential course staff roles; most non-TAs complete 3 hours per week). Students thus far find it to be worthwhile.

We've received 200+ applications for the past several semesters so please apply by Oct. 31 for highest priority. We are scaling to 160 students, and the sections will be Wednesdays 5:00pm-6:30pm or Thursdays 5:00pm-6:30pm.

Application: https://goo.gl/forms/aYbNmBweaHePyKuD2

For more information, check out our website:

http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/~cs370/…

For our student feedback, check out our HKN Evaluations:
https://hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu/coursesurveys/course/CS/370

Feel free to email cthunn@berkeley.edu with questions

PS Please also feel free to distribute this via relevant channels (Piazzas, student orgs, etc.).
history.subject: Take CS370: Teaching CS this Spring; application is now live!
